    <dd>Specifies whether the browser should include credentials such as cookies or authentication when making requests. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Valid values are <code>*</code>, <code>Cache-Control</code>, <code>Content-Language</code>, <code>Content-Length</code>, <code>Content-Type</code>, <code>Expires</code>, <code>Last-Modified</code>, or <code>Pragma</code>. Dependent on your use-case other headers can be exposed, consult the Access-Control-Expose-Headers documentation.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolmaxageheadervalue_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolmaxageheadervalue_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Access<wbr>Control<wbr>Max<wbr>Age<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Specifies how long the results of a preflight request can be cached, in seconds. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Valid values are between <code>0</code> and <code>86400</code>. This value is browser specific, consult the Access-Control-Max-Age documentation.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponsecontentsecuritypolicyheadervalue_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponsecontentsecuritypolicyheadervalue_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Content<wbr>Security<wbr>Policy<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Specifies restrictions enforced by the browser to help minimize the risk of certain types of security threats. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Values for this are extensive, and can be impactful when set, consult Content-Security-Policy documentation.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponseserverenabled_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponseserverenabled_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Server<wbr>Enabled</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">bool</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Enables you to allow or remove the HTTP response server header. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Valid values are <code>true</code> or <code>false</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponsestricttransportsecurityheadervalue_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponsestricttransportsecurityheadervalue_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Strict<wbr>Transport<wbr>Security<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Informs browsers that the site should only be accessed using HTTPS, and that any future attempts to access it using HTTP should automatically be converted to HTTPS. Default values are <code>max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload</code> consult the Strict-Transport-Security documentation for further details.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponsexcontenttypeoptionsheadervalue_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponsexcontenttypeoptionsheadervalue_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>XContent<wbr>Type<wbr>Options<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Indicates whether the MIME types advertised in the Content-Type headers should be followed and not be changed. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. The only valid value is <code>nosniff</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponsexframeoptionsheadervalue_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponsexframeoptionsheadervalue_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>XFrame<wbr>Options<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Indicates whether the browser is allowed to render a page in a frame, iframe, embed or object. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. The only valid values are <code>DENY</code>, <code>SAMEORIGIN</code>, or <code>ALLOW-FROM https://example.com</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_sslpolicy_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_sslpolicy_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Ssl<wbr>Policy</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Name of the SSL Policy for the listener. Required if <code>protocol</code> is <code>HTTPS</code> or <code>TLS</code>. Default is <code>ELBSecurityPolicy-2016-08</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_tags_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_tags_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Tags</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">map[string]string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A map of tags to assign to the resource. .If configured with a provider <code>default_tags</code> configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note::</strong> When a <code>Name</code> key is specified in the map, the AWS Console maps the value to the <code>Name Tag</code> column value inside the <code>Listener Rules</code> table within a specific load balancer listener page. Otherwise, the value resolves to <code>Default</code>.</p>
</blockquote>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-deprecated"
            title="Optional, Deprecated">
        <span id="state_tagsall_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_tagsall_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Tags<wbr>All</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">map[string]string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>A map of tags assigned to the resource, including those inherited from the provider <code>default_tags</code> configuration block.<p class="property-message">Deprecated: Please use <code>tags</code> instead.</p></dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_tcpidletimeoutseconds_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_tcpidletimeoutseconds_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Tcp<wbr>Idle<wbr>Timeout<wbr>Seconds</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>TCP idle timeout value in seconds. Can only be set if protocol is <code>TCP</code> on Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Not supported for Application Load Balancers. Valid values are between <code>60</code> and <code>6000</code> inclusive. Default: <code>350</code>.</dd></dl>

For Network Load Balancers, valid values are <code>TCP</code>, <code>TLS</code>, <code>UDP</code>, and <code>TCP_UDP</code>.             title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolallowcredentialsheadervalue_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolallowcredentialsheadervalue_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Access<wbr>Control<wbr>Allow<wbr>Credentials<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>

            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolallowheadersheadervalue_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolallowheadersheadervalue_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Access<wbr>Control<wbr>Allow<wbr>Headers<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Specifies which headers can be used during the request. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Valid values are <code>*</code>, <code>Accept</code>, <code>Accept-Language</code>, <code>Cache-Control</code>, <code>Content-Language</code>, <code>Content-Length</code>, <code>Content-Type</code>, <code>Expires</code>, <code>Last-Modified</code>, <code>Pragma</code>. Dependent on your use-case other headers can be exposed and then set as a value consult the Access-Control-Allow-Headers documentation.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolallowmethodsheadervalue_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolallowmethodsheadervalue_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Access<wbr>Control<wbr>Allow<wbr>Methods<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Set which HTTP methods are allowed when accessing the server from a different origin. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Valid values are <code>GET</code>, <code>HEAD</code>, <code>POST</code>, <code>DELETE</code>, <code>CONNECT</code>, <code>OPTIONS</code>, <code>TRACE</code> or <code>PATCH</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolalloworiginheadervalue_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolalloworiginheadervalue_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Access<wbr>Control<wbr>Allow<wbr>Origin<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Specifies which origins are allowed to access the server. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. A valid value is a URI, eg: <code>https://example.com</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolexposeheadersheadervalue_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolexposeheadersheadervalue_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Access<wbr>Control<wbr>Expose<wbr>Headers<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Specifies whether the browser should include credentials such as cookies or authentication when making requests. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Valid values are <code>*</code>, <code>Cache-Control</code>, <code>Content-Language</code>, <code>Content-Length</code>, <code>Content-Type</code>, <code>Expires</code>, <code>Last-Modified</code>, or <code>Pragma</code>. Dependent on your use-case other headers can be exposed, consult the Access-Control-Expose-Headers documentation.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolmaxageheadervalue_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolmaxageheadervalue_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Access<wbr>Control<wbr>Max<wbr>Age<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Specifies how long the results of a preflight request can be cached, in seconds. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Valid values are between <code>0</code> and <code>86400</code>. This value is browser specific, consult the Access-Control-Max-Age documentation.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponsecontentsecuritypolicyheadervalue_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponsecontentsecuritypolicyheadervalue_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Content<wbr>Security<wbr>Policy<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Specifies restrictions enforced by the browser to help minimize the risk of certain types of security threats. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Values for this are extensive, and can be impactful when set, consult Content-Security-Policy documentation.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponseserverenabled_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponseserverenabled_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Server<wbr>Enabled</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Enables you to allow or remove the HTTP response server header. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Valid values are <code>true</code> or <code>false</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponsestricttransportsecurityheadervalue_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponsestricttransportsecurityheadervalue_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Strict<wbr>Transport<wbr>Security<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Informs browsers that the site should only be accessed using HTTPS, and that any future attempts to access it using HTTP should automatically be converted to HTTPS. Default values are <code>max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload</code> consult the Strict-Transport-Security documentation for further details.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponsexcontenttypeoptionsheadervalue_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponsexcontenttypeoptionsheadervalue_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>XContent<wbr>Type<wbr>Options<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Indicates whether the MIME types advertised in the Content-Type headers should be followed and not be changed. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. The only valid value is <code>nosniff</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponsexframeoptionsheadervalue_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponsexframeoptionsheadervalue_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>XFrame<wbr>Options<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Indicates whether the browser is allowed to render a page in a frame, iframe, embed or object. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. The only valid values are <code>DENY</code>, <code>SAMEORIGIN</code>, or <code>ALLOW-FROM https://example.com</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_sslpolicy_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_sslpolicy_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">ssl<wbr>Policy</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Name of the SSL Policy for the listener. Required if <code>protocol</code> is <code>HTTPS</code> or <code>TLS</code>. Default is <code>ELBSecurityPolicy-2016-08</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_tags_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_tags_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">tags</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Map&lt;String,String&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A map of tags to assign to the resource. .If configured with a provider <code>default_tags</code> configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note::</strong> When a <code>Name</code> key is specified in the map, the AWS Console maps the value to the <code>Name Tag</code> column value inside the <code>Listener Rules</code> table within a specific load balancer listener page. Otherwise, the value resolves to <code>Default</code>.</p>
</blockquote>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-deprecated"
            title="Optional, Deprecated">
        <span id="state_tagsall_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_tagsall_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">tags<wbr>All</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Map&lt;String,String&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>A map of tags assigned to the resource, including those inherited from the provider <code>default_tags</code> configuration block.<p class="property-message">Deprecated: Please use <code>tags</code> instead.</p></dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_tcpidletimeoutseconds_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_tcpidletimeoutseconds_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">tcp<wbr>Idle<wbr>Timeout<wbr>Seconds</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Integer</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>TCP idle timeout value in seconds. Can only be set if protocol is <code>TCP</code> on Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Not supported for Application Load Balancers. Valid values are between <code>60</code> and <code>6000</code> inclusive. Default: <code>350</code>.</dd></dl>

For Network Load Balancers, valid values are <code>TCP</code>, <code>TLS</code>, <code>UDP</code>, and <code>TCP_UDP</code>.             title="Optional">

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">{[key: string]: string}</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A map of tags to assign to the resource. .If configured with a provider <code>default_tags</code> configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note::</strong> When a <code>Name</code> key is specified in the map, the AWS Console maps the value to the <code>Name Tag</code> column value inside the <code>Listener Rules</code> table within a specific load balancer listener page. </span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Protocol for connections from clients to the load balancer. For Application Load Balancers, valid values are <code>HTTP</code> and <code>HTTPS</code>, with a default of <code>HTTP</code>. For Network Load Balancers, valid values are <code>TCP</code>, <code>TLS</code>, <code>UDP</code>, and <code>TCP_UDP</code>.             title="Optional">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>

            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_tags_python">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Mapping[str, str]</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A map of tags to assign to the resource. .If configured with a provider <code>default_tags</code> configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note::</strong> When a <code>Name</code> key is specified in the map, the AWS Console maps the value to the <code>Name Tag</code> column value inside the <code>Listener Rules</code> table within a specific load balancer listener page. Otherwise, the value resolves to <code>Default</code>.</p>
</blockquote>

        <span id="state_protocol_yaml">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Protocol for connections from clients to the load balancer. For Application Load Balancers, valid values are <code>HTTP</code> and <code>HTTPS</code>, with a default of <code>HTTP</code>. For Network Load Balancers, valid values are <code>TCP</code>, <code>TLS</code>, <code>UDP</code>, and <code>TCP_UDP</code>.             title="Optional">

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Enables you to modify the header name of the <code>X-Amzn-Mtls-Clientcert</code> HTTP request header. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">

            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolallowheadersheadervalue_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolallowheadersheadervalue_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Access<wbr>Control<wbr>Allow<wbr>Headers<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Specifies which headers can be used during the request. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Valid values are <code>*</code>, <code>Accept</code>, <code>Accept-Language</code>, <code>Cache-Control</code>, <code>Content-Language</code>, <code>Content-Length</code>, <code>Content-Type</code>, <code>Expires</code>, <code>Last-Modified</code>, <code>Pragma</code>. Dependent on your use-case other headers can be exposed and then set as a value consult the Access-Control-Allow-Headers documentation.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolallowmethodsheadervalue_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolallowmethodsheadervalue_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Access<wbr>Control<wbr>Allow<wbr>Methods<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Set which HTTP methods are allowed when accessing the server from a different origin. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Valid values are <code>GET</code>, <code>HEAD</code>, <code>POST</code>, <code>DELETE</code>, <code>CONNECT</code>, <code>OPTIONS</code>, <code>TRACE</code> or <code>PATCH</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolalloworiginheadervalue_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolalloworiginheadervalue_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Access<wbr>Control<wbr>Allow<wbr>Origin<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Specifies which origins are allowed to access the server. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. A valid value is a URI, eg: <code>https://example.com</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolexposeheadersheadervalue_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolexposeheadersheadervalue_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Access<wbr>Control<wbr>Expose<wbr>Headers<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Specifies whether the browser should include credentials such as cookies or authentication when making requests. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Valid values are <code>*</code>, <code>Cache-Control</code>, <code>Content-Language</code>, <code>Content-Length</code>, <code>Content-Type</code>, <code>Expires</code>, <code>Last-Modified</code>, or <code>Pragma</code>. Dependent on your use-case other headers can be exposed, consult the Access-Control-Expose-Headers documentation.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolmaxageheadervalue_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponseaccesscontrolmaxageheadervalue_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Access<wbr>Control<wbr>Max<wbr>Age<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Specifies how long the results of a preflight request can be cached, in seconds. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Valid values are between <code>0</code> and <code>86400</code>. This value is browser specific, consult the Access-Control-Max-Age documentation.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponsecontentsecuritypolicyheadervalue_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponsecontentsecuritypolicyheadervalue_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Content<wbr>Security<wbr>Policy<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Specifies restrictions enforced by the browser to help minimize the risk of certain types of security threats. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Values for this are extensive, and can be impactful when set, consult Content-Security-Policy documentation.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponseserverenabled_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponseserverenabled_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Server<wbr>Enabled</a>

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Enables you to allow or remove the HTTP response server header. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Valid values are <code>true</code> or <code>false</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponsestricttransportsecurityheadervalue_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponsestricttransportsecurityheadervalue_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>Strict<wbr>Transport<wbr>Security<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Informs browsers that the site should only be accessed using HTTPS, and that any future attempts to access it using HTTP should automatically be converted to HTTPS. Default values are <code>max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload</code> consult the Strict-Transport-Security documentation for further details.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponsexcontenttypeoptionsheadervalue_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponsexcontenttypeoptionsheadervalue_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>XContent<wbr>Type<wbr>Options<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Indicates whether the MIME types advertised in the Content-Type headers should be followed and not be changed. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. The only valid value is <code>nosniff</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_routinghttpresponsexframeoptionsheadervalue_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_routinghttpresponsexframeoptionsheadervalue_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">routing<wbr>Http<wbr>Response<wbr>XFrame<wbr>Options<wbr>Header<wbr>Value</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Indicates whether the browser is allowed to render a page in a frame, iframe, embed or object. Can only be set if protocol is <code>HTTP</code> or <code>HTTPS</code> for Application Load Balancers. Not supported for Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. The only valid values are <code>DENY</code>, <code>SAMEORIGIN</code>, or <code>ALLOW-FROM https://example.com</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_sslpolicy_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_sslpolicy_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">ssl<wbr>Policy</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Name of the SSL Policy for the listener. Required if <code>protocol</code> is <code>HTTPS</code> or <code>TLS</code>. Default is <code>ELBSecurityPolicy-2016-08</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_tags_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_tags_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">tags</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Map&lt;String&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A map of tags to assign to the resource. .If configured with a provider <code>default_tags</code> configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.</p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Note::</strong> When a <code>Name</code> key is specified in the map, the AWS Console maps the value to the <code>Name Tag</code> column value inside the <code>Listener Rules</code> table within a specific load balancer listener page. Otherwise, the value resolves to <code>Default</code>.</p>
</blockquote>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-deprecated"
            title="Optional, Deprecated">
        <span id="state_tagsall_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_tagsall_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">tags<wbr>All</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Map&lt;String&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>A map of tags assigned to the resource, including those inherited from the provider <code>default_tags</code> configuration block.<p class="property-message">Deprecated: Please use <code>tags</code> instead.</p></dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="state_tcpidletimeoutseconds_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#state_tcpidletimeoutseconds_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">tcp<wbr>Idle<wbr>Timeout<wbr>Seconds</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Number</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>TCP idle timeout value in seconds. Can only be set if protocol is <code>TCP</code> on Network Load Balancer, or with a Gateway Load Balancer. Not supported for Application Load Balancers. Valid values are between <code>60</code> and <code>6000</code> inclusive. Default: <code>350</code>.</dd></dl>

## Supporting Types



<h4 id="listenerdefaultaction">
Listener<wbr>Default<wbr>Action<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="python,go" class="inline">, Listener<wbr>Default<wbr>Action<wbr>Args</pulumi-choosable>
</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="type_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#type_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Type</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Type of routing action. Valid values are <code>forward</code>, <code>redirect</code>, <code>fixed-response</code>, <code>authenticate-cognito</code> and <code>authenticate-oidc</code>.</p>
<p>The following arguments are optional:</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="authenticatecognito_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#authenticatecognito_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Authenticate<wbr>Cognito</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#listenerdefaultactionauthenticatecognito">Listener<wbr>Default<wbr>Action<wbr>Authenticate<wbr>Cognito</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Configuration block for using Amazon Cognito to authenticate users. Specify only when <code>type</code> is <code>authenticate-cognito</code>. See below.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="authenticateoidc_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#authenticateoidc_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Authenticate<wbr>Oidc</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#listenerdefaultactionauthenticateoidc">Listener<wbr>Default<wbr>Action<wbr>Authenticate<wbr>Oidc</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Configuration block for an identity provider that is compliant with OpenID Connect (OIDC). Specify only when <code>type</code> is <code>authenticate-oidc</code>. See below.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="fixedresponse_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#fixedresponse_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Fixed<wbr>Response</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#listenerdefaultactionfixedresponse">Listener<wbr>Default<wbr>Action<wbr>Fixed<wbr>Response</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Information for creating an action that returns a custom HTTP response. Required if <code>type</code> is <code>fixed-response</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="forward_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#forward_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Forward</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#listenerdefaultactionforward">Listener<wbr>Default<wbr>Action<wbr>Forward</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Configuration block for creating an action that distributes requests among one or more target groups. Specify only if <code>type</code> is <code>forward</code>. See below.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="order_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#order_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Order</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Order for the action. The action with the lowest value for order is performed first. Valid values are between <code>1</code> and <code>50000</code>. Defaults to the position in the list of actions.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="redirect_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#redirect_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Redirect</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#listenerdefaultactionredirect">Listener<wbr>Default<wbr>Action<wbr>Redirect</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Configuration block for creating a redirect action. Required if <code>type</code> is <code>redirect</code>. See below.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="targetgrouparn_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#targetgrouparn_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Target<wbr>Group<wbr>Arn</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>ARN of the Target Group to which to route traffic. Specify only if <code>type</code> is <code>forward</code> and you want to route to a single target group. To route to one or more target groups, use a <code>forward</code> block instead. Can be specified with <code>forward</code> but ARNs must match.</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#listenerdefaultactionauthenticateoidc">Listener<wbr>Default<wbr>Action<wbr>Authenticate<wbr>Oidc</a></span>

    <dd>Configuration block for an identity provider that is compliant with OpenID Connect (OIDC). Specify only when <code>type</code> is <code>authenticate-oidc</code>. See below.</dd><dt class="property-optional"

    </dt>
    <dd>Information for creating an action that returns a custom HTTP response. Required if <code>type</code> is <code>fixed-response</code>.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="forward_go">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#listenerdefaultactionforward">Listener<wbr>Default<wbr>Action<wbr>Forward</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Configuration block for creating an action that distributes requests among one or more target groups. Specify only if <code>type</code> is <code>forward</code>. See below.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="order_go">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Order for the action. The action with the lowest value for order is performed first. Valid values are between <code>1</code> and <code>50000</code>. Defaults to the position in the list of actions.</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="redirect_go">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>ARN of the Target Group to which to route traffic. Specify only if <code>type</code> is <code>forward</code> and you want to route to a single target group. To route to one or more target groups, use a <code>forward</code> block instead. Can be specified with <code>forward</code> but ARNs must match.</dd></dl>

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import listeners using their ARN. For example:

```sh
$ pulumi import aws:alb/listener:Listener front_end arn:aws:elasticloadbalancing:us-west-2:187416307283:listener/app/front-end-alb/8e4497da625e2d8a/9ab28ade35828f96
```


To learn more about importing existing cloud resources, see [Importing resources](/docs/using-pulumi/adopting-pulumi/import/).
